job_title: PAL Peer Assistant Leader in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Great way to get experience working with college students along side the professor.
cons:
-Temporary 
-Limited Hours
-Other than that great job during college

job_title: Instructor in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Lots of money to build facilities; dedicated instructors and staff; a reasonably attractive (though increasingly bedraggled) campus, investments in solar power and cogeneration, some improvements in campus security.
cons: Lack of marketing, low enrollment, class cancellations, diminishing academic excellence, disastrously confusing website, obfuscated enrollment process, obsession with buildings and campuses, heartless bean counters, poor communication, etc. Too many administrators across too many campuses without enough workers.

job_title: Student Tutor in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Can be paid to do your own homeowrk
cons: Pay is low so when it is busy and a lot of people need help you work hard for not much pay

job_title: Program Specialist in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Flexible work hours are good
cons: Hard to become a full-time employee. High turnover rate in temp positions.

job_title: Faculty in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Beautiful location, great staff and students.

job_title: Teacher Assistant in Santa Rosa, CA

Excellent teaching opportunity offers opportunities to work with modern equipment and tools.

job_title: Student Worker in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Flexible Schedule around classes, great pay, wonderful people

job_title: Peer Tutor in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: easy to find students to tutor and you can get practice in whatever you're tutoring

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: some colleagues are respectful, flexible scheduling, can teach online, can serve on certain committee for pay, strong union protections, good protections for academic freedom, students are wonderful, professional development opportunities
cons: they very rarely hire part-time faculty into full-time positions, so zero room for advancement, college president & board don't seem to respect faculty, staff, or students

job_title: Student Library Assistant in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Loved working at this library. Perfect part time job for a student. Lovely managers/supervisors. You can study if downtown.
cons: I have really nothing negative to say about this job

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Great Work Life flexibility. Warm and encouraging environment. The Teachers and fellow administrators make wonderful co-workers.
cons: If you start in a student worker position then there is not a whole lot of upward mobility. They like to look outside the company for a diverse staff.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: good safe environment for working
cons: low pay not enough hours

review_title: Close campus community that values their employees and students
job_title: Adjunct Faculty Member in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: The campus community is incredibly committed to excellence. The love for the students, the teaching profession, and the work being done at this school is taken so seriously and you feel like you are a part of something bigger than yourself by working there.
cons: If you don't live close by the commute can be rough... but that is typical for the Bay Area. It's a commuter campus, so not a lot of food services on campus, but there are a lot of great restaurants near by.

review_title: Stress of the job is dependent on who your supervisor is
job_title: Student Helper in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: In some departments you can do homework when there isn't much work to be done
cons: In certain departments you're given busy work that doesn't add any value to the department you're working in

job_title: Academic Tutor in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Easy and flexible work hours
cons: low pay, unrewarding, some annoying coworkers

job_title: Student Health Administrator in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Great workplace environment, family-like culture with all other employees, almost monthly fun and educational events with free food, various training, fantastic supervisors, and lots of attention and understanding when it comes to work-life balance and mental health.
cons: Little room for growth (in student positions), but there are still some higher positions that students can apply for later down the line in their career

job_title: Academic Counselor in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Great academic offerings in Associate of Arts Degrees
cons: Need more Allied Health offerings

job_title: ESL Teacher in San Francisco, CA
pros: A great community and place to work!
cons: Hard to come by full-time tenure positions.

job_title: Student Success Coach in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Great environment to grow and meet people

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Awesome people: my colleagues and my students
cons: Teaching online, folks don't make use of all the material provided. Harder to keep students engaged.

job_title: Front Desk Assistant in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Good people, friendly work environment
cons: Sometimes hard to satisfy customers

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Calabasas, CA
pros: Pay has increased, good work culture
cons: Hours are sporadic sometimes. Thats about it.

job_title: STNC in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: There is so much potential to make a difference and be a part of a positive community,. Santa Rosa Community College has great possibility to be a wonderful resource for the student population as well as the community.
cons: When you are "in" your are a part of a team and when you are part of the"in" you are definitely not feeling party to the obvious difference as the "out". The facility is wrought with possiblity but try to get a decent shot at a job w/out the inside connection. Do not step in the ring unless you are tight with someone who can protect you from the inevitable nics and scratches you will receive as the newbie. There are so many pockets being padded here, fluff and waste particularly in the tenured staff and faculty, the who is sleeping with who crowd. It is a hideous waste of resources. Once you are"in" who is gonna touch you, it is a carpet ride to the end. Sad no real evaluations are done  w/ re: to either the faculty or the staff.

review_title: Amazing accomplishments with even more potential
job_title: Classified Staff in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Passionate staff and faculty. The work ethic here is frequently superhuman. President Chong is an inspiring leader, and people really are here for the students. A city unto itself, with great camaraderie and affection among its denizens.
cons: We educate others, but staff development and current technology lags severely. Paper forms that should be online, collaboration tools are desperately needed. Because everyone is so passionate about the mission here, it's difficult for anyone to say no to anything. Any project that will benefit students, people will move heaven and earth to make it happen. This means people are often over-committed, overworked, and exhausted. Health is an increasing worry, though it has come to management's attention and they are actively encouraging cultural changes to help with this (though without changing the workload).

job_title: Student Success Specialist in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Great benefits, employee sponsored health benefits that covers up to family of 4 with no deduction from paycheck. The retirement is a state pension system which is uncommon and really good. Employee development opportunities, health and wellness program. 14 holidays a year!
cons: Since its a state job, you get paid once a month, tough if you don't know how to manage your money, but if you do then its nice to pay all your bills and then have the rest for spending money.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: I worked at SRJC for 22 years. Overall, it was a pleasant experience.  The best thing: the lack of bureaucracy. Purchase orders are issued quickly, often on the spot. There is blessedly little "policy". Mind you, I retired 10 years ago.
cons: The downside is the same at all colleges, and, I expect, at all long-time jobs: repetition. There isn't a lot of room to create a new job for oneself. Academic departments are territorial and not particularly open to new ideas. This is not unique to SRJC.

job_title: in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: The support for this institution is unlike anything I have seen nationally towards 2 year colleges.  This institution is as highly regarded in this community as any 4 year university.
cons: The bureacracy here is a nightmare  - endemic throughout the California system.  There is a strong sense of pecking order and entitlement among older employees.  The California budget crisis makes for a lot of uncertainty.

review_title: Associated Student Senate, VP of Programs
job_title: Vice President of Programs in Santa Rosa, CA
pros:
* Access to several administrators for mentoring and skills developing
* Availability to resources not ordinarily obtainable by students
cons:
* Too many signatures and departments needed before any activity can be approved 
* In fighting between staff can make it difficult for students to get needed assistance

review_title: Administative Assistant II to DIrector of Adult Education Consortium
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: This company does a lot to give back to its community as well as the students.  They have wonderful benefits packages as well as 401 and retirement
cons: The process that you go though to get hired on full-time can take up 6 months depending on the urgency of the needs of the position.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Great people, wonderful students, nice pay and benefits.
cons: It takes forever to get anything done.  The paperwork for the simplest thing is unreal. Things that should be done online isn't.  The hiring process can take up to 5 months.  No one knows what the other person is doing.

review_title: Great for getting your foot in the door.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Works around school schedule if you're a student, unless it's full-time. Friendly staff.
cons: Student employees don't really make anything, just barely a dollar over the minimum wage. I get it, it is to get experience. I've known people who had full time jobs and they love it.

job_title: Student Administrative Assistant in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: My time here at the Santa Rosa Junior College has taught me the importance the purchasing department has in order for this institution to function
cons: Due to the limitations of the school's budget, my position cannot provide an opportunity to make this a  permanent position.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Flexible hours, training staff, wonderful working environment, friendly coworkers
cons: A cap/limit of 25 hours a week, only basic entry-level jobs

job_title: Student Success Technician in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: The pay and the benefits.
cons: Politics and not getting higher raises. Hard to get a promotion or move up in a different position.

job_title: Mathlab Assistant in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Very nice people work at the Shuhaw Hall Mathlab! A supportive group of friends.  Flexible hours, and someone can always cover for you if something comes up.
cons: No school-wide benefits other than pay.

job_title: Student Ambassador in Petaluma, CA
pros: Very friendly and welcoming place to work. Small campus makes it a comfortable environment and everyone knows everyone from the Dean to the janitor.
cons: I can't think of anything.

review_title: Teaching is a Very Rewarding Profession
